Sure, here are some suggestions for b-roll/stock video clips/stock photos to accompany the script:

[Visual] A person measuring their waist with a measuring tape

[Script] "Are you tired of feeling hungry all the time? Frustrated with trying to lose weight by eating less and less only to see minimal results."

[Visual] A person cutting vegetables on a cutting board

[Script] "What if I told you that you can eat more and still lose weight? Sound too good to be true?"

[Visual] A person preparing a healthy meal

[Script] "Keep watching because today we're going to explore the surprising science behind how eating more can actually help you shed those extra pounds."

[Visual] A Be Healthy and Thrive logo or intro animation

[Script] "Hey there. Welcome back to Be Healthy and Thrive. In this video, we're going to talk about why eating more can help you lose weight."

[Visual] A person exercising or running

[Script] "If you're new to our channel, make sure to hit that subscribe button and the notification bell so you don't miss out on any of our latest health and fitness tips."

[Visual] A person measuring their weight on a scale

[Script] "And if you like this video, give it a thumbs up and let us know in the comments below."

[Visual] A person holding a piece of fruit

[Script] "But before we dive in, I'll have a bonus tip that can take your weight loss efforts to the next level. Keep watching to find out what it is."

[Visual] An image of a calorie tracker or chart

[Script] "First, let's talk about calories."

[Visual] A person eating a balanced meal with protein, vegetables, and whole grains

[Script] "When it comes to weight loss, calories are king."

[Visual] A person pouring a glass of water

[Script] "You need to burn more calories than you consume in order to lose weight."

[Visual] A person eating a small portion of food on a smaller plate

[Script] "That's where the concept of calorie deficit comes in. In other words, you need to eat fewer calories than you burn in order to lose weight."

[Visual] A person eating a piece of chicken or fish

[Script] "However, there's a common misconception that you need to eat as little as possible in order to create a calorie deficit."

[Visual] A person snacking on fruits or vegetables

[Script] "The truth is, if you restrict your calories too much, your body will go into starvation mode and slow down your metabolism to conserve energy, making it harder to lose weight."

[Visual] A person drinking a glass of water

[Script] "So how can you create a calorie deficit without starving yourself?"

[Visual] A person eating a bowl of salad

[Script] "The answer is to eat more of the right foods, specifically foods that are high in protein, fiber, and water content can help boost your metabolism and help you burn more calorie."

[Visual] A person measuring their food on a food scale

[Script] "Some examples of these foods include lean proteins. This can include chicken, which is loaded with protein and is lower in calories than other protein choices since it is lean and low in fat."

[Visual] A person cooking fish in a pan

[Script] "Fish that is high in omega-3. Fatty acids like salmon, tuna, and trout, can support brain function and are linked to reduced risk of heart disease, stroke, and certain types of cancer."
